title: Poor Charlie's Almanack
author: Charlie Munger
insight: The psychology of human misjudgment chapter alone is worth the price. Munger's mental models approach changed how I think about decisions.

title: Chronicles: Volume One
author: Bob Dylan
insight: Dylan writes about New York in the early 60s like he's painting it. The way he describes discovering folk music in the Village is pure poetry.
quote: I had ambitions to set out and find like an odyssey or some kind of cup of gold.

title: American Gods
author: Neil Gaiman
insight: Old gods brought to America by immigrants, fading as belief fades. The roadside attractions chapter is haunting and funny.
quote: People believe things, which means they're easy to fool.

title: Good Omens
author: Terry Pratchett & Neil Gaiman
insight: An angel and a demon trying to stop the apocalypse because they've grown fond of Earth. Every page has a joke that lands.
quote: It may help to understand human affairs to be clear that most of the great triumphs and tragedies of history are caused, not by people being fundamentally good or fundamentally bad, but by people being fundamentally people.

title: Right Ho, Jeeves
author: P.G. Wodehouse
insight: The funniest sentences in the English language. Wodehouse makes you laugh out loud on trains and look like a maniac. Pure joy.
quote: There is only one cure for gray hair. It was invented by a Frenchman. It is called the guillotine.

title: The 4-Hour Workweek
author: Tim Ferriss
insight: Ignore the title. The real value is learning to question default assumptions about work, time, and what you actually want.
quote: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
insight: A comfort reread. The maps, the songs, the riddles in the dark. Adventure that feels like home.
quote: If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
insight: The world-building that launched a thousand fantasy novels. Leaving the Shire never gets old.
quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.

title: The Two Towers
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
insight: Sam carrying Frodo up Mount Doom is the heart of the whole trilogy. Loyalty in the dark.
quote: There is some good in this world, and it's worth fighting for.

title: The Return of the King
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
insight: The scouring of the Shire hit different as an adult. You can't go home the same person.
quote: I will not say: do not weep; for not all tears are an evil.

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
author: Haruki Murakami
insight: Surreal and slow-burning. A man sits at the bottom of a well and the world unravels. Murakami teaches quiet persistence.
